j. r. firth.gloss: English linguist who contributed to linguistic semantics and to prosodic phonology and who was noted for his insistence on studying both sound and meaning in context (1890-1960)

j.r.r. tolkien.gloss: British philologist and writer of fantasies (born in South Africa) (1892-1973)

jr.gloss: a son who has the same first name as his father

jra.gloss: a terrorist group organized in 1970 to overthrow the Japanese government and monarchy and to foment world revolution

jr..gloss: used of the younger of two persons of the same name especially used to distinguish a son from his father
